Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the proactive nature of Apple Support in calling users to inform them about suspicious activity or compromises.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the statement that Apple Support would proactively call users in such situations.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Apple Support would always proactively call users about suspicious activity or compromises, without considering other possible methods of communication or verification.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility of scammers using caller-ID spoofing to mimic Apple Support and deceive users.
